intro: Cressa nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender cress, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its flowers are typically arranged in terminal or axillary clusters and are pollinated by insects. Cressa nudicaulis is often found in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks, roadsides, and in meadows.
